newsitem.title: USA: Olympus Ventures sets reverse stock split.
newsitem.headline: Olympus Ventures sets reverse stock split.

text.p: Olympus Ventures Inc said that it set a reverse stock split of 30 for one, effective midnight on January 21 and its shares are trading under a new stock symbol, OVIS.

Olympus, which is a manufacturer of knit, denim and twill garments, said that it did these actions in order to meet Nasdaq's qualifications for small capitalization companies, and to reduce its float, or number of shares trading publicly.
The company is also seeking financing to fund its internal growth and to help fulfill purchase order contracts. Its fiscal year sales are projected to reach $12 million, it said.
